system.description:
You learn to weave an almost musical beat into your chanting and muttering, perhaps even using instruments to accent your dirging—not to create music, of course, but just to make your noise that much more effective. Choose one of the following; while using the appropriate instrument to accent your chanting, your @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.aw3shf33a5piftdd]{Battle Dirges} are improved in the following ways:

  • Percussion: The range of your battle dirges doubles.
  • String Instruments: You may expend two uses of your @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.el6nhqunz3mytxw6]{Mind-Numbing Chant} to cause a creature that resists your battle dirge to take disadvantage on its save. You may do this no more than 3 times per day.
  • Wind Instruments: You may make a Deception or Performance check when performing a battle dirge. Any creature with a passive Perception lower than your check does not realize the magical nature of your battle dirge and does not automatically connect the results of your battle dirge with your actions.
  • Doublespeak: You may start a @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.3qc1rqk8rwvl8van]{Battle Hymn} and a battle dirge with the same bonus action.
